author: Diane Cole
title: Review: Anne Spoerry ‘In Full Flight’
text:
Few life stories are as confounding as that of Anne Spoerry (1918-99), a physician whose tale of unconscionable evil and quest for expiation spanned several decades and two continents.
In Kenya, where the Swiss-French expatriate made her home starting in the late 1940s, Spoerry was revered as “Mama Daktari,” an indefatigable “mother doctor” and the first female member of the Flying Doctors service of the African Medical and Research Foundation (the nongovernmental organization now known as Amref Health Africa). For more than...
